author: Dan Strumpf
title: In U.S.-China Tech Rivalry, Whose Side Is Qualcomm On? - WSJ
text:
Qualcomm Inc.’s strategic value to the U.S. saved the company from a possible hostile takeover. It also puts the mobile-chip giant firmly at the center of an escalating tech rivalry between its home country and its biggest market: China.

In cutting off Singapore-based Broadcom Ltd.’s $117 billion bid for Qualcomm, President Donald Trump cited national security concerns raised by China’s growing strength in an array of advanced technologies. These include the fifth-generation wireless technology, known as 5G, that will usher... RELATED VIDEO The Modern Cell Carrier: How We Got Here The U.S. wireless industry is dominated by four major players: Verizon, AT&T, T-Mobile and Sprint. Now that just about everyone has a cellphone, each operator is looking for new ways to grow. But how did we go from the days of one giant landline monopoly to four competitive cell companies?
